admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impacts substantial. The Bank performance is rated
            satisfactory, having provided substantial advice to the
            Government on cost-based tariffs, and, the Borrower's
            performance is assessed as highly satisfactory, given the
            outstanding performance of implementing agencies,
            particularly regarding the timely procurement
            implementation. Lessons address primarily, the extensive
            interaction between the Bank, and the Government to achieve
            the policy action plan, based on a comprehensive sector
            study, which fostered sector reforms in an open dialogue
            with stakeholders, leading to the success of the project.
            The dramatic achievements made by China in sector
            performance, within the current competitive, market-driven
            economy environment, led the Government to recognize the
            crucial need for institutional, and legal framework, in
            attaining sector reforms, through the Bank's
            assistance. The borrower not only strictly complied with the
            Bank procurement guidelines, facilitating speedy
            procurement/disbursement processes, but motivated an
            absorbing capacity, to benefit from the technical assistance
            provided to accelerate sector reforms. This unquestionably
            contributed to the expansion of telecommunication networks
            in rural areas, and secured, in part, financing for the
            investment plan, aimed at reaching a hundred percent coverage.
